data.text: I said in my heart,
I said to laughter, Madness:
And I examined whether my heart
I enlarged my work;
I made me gardens and orchards,
I made me pools of water,
I got servants and maidens,
Moreover I collected for myself both silver and gold also,
So I became great,
And whatever mine eyes desired,
And I looked on all my works
Then I looked on to see wisdom,
And I saw that wisdom excels folly,
The wise manâ€™s eyes are in his head;
And I said in my heart,
For there is no remembrance of the wise man
So I hated life;
And I hated the whole of my labor
And who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool?
So I went about to dismiss from my heart
For there is such a man that his labor
For it happens to a man in all his labor,
For all his days
A man has nothing really good
For who shall eat, or who shall drink, without him?
For God has given to the man
